vision.notes: Sea urchins generally possess light-sensitive cells distributed across their body surface, but specific visual capabilities in Cidaridae are not detailed in the provided context.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely present due to the general echinoderm body plan and need to sense the environment. Inference based on the general biology of sea urchins.

chemoreception.notes: Likely present, similar to other sea urchins, for detecting food and other chemical cues in their environment. Inference based on the general biology of sea urchins.
